text: Pre-Lecture Quiz, Chapter 14, Nonopioid Analgesics: Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs (NSAIDs) and Migraine Headache Medications Multiple Choice 1. Select the client group that may be hardest to assess for pain. 1. Children aged 10 years or older 2. Elders with good cognition 3. Clients with limited English proficiency 4. Clients a couple hours after surgery True/False 1. A key component to good pain management is the pain assessment. 2. NSAIDs are a first-line choice for treating arthritis-related conditions. 3. Mild to moderate pain is treated with NSAIDs. 4. The action that helps NSAIDs reduce pain also causes gastrointestinal distress. 5. CGRP blocking agents are used to block perception and vasodilation during an acute migraine. Fill in the Blank 1. Pain assessment is often termed the __________ vital sign. 2. The intensity of pain is _________________; therefore, it is typically measured using standardized tools. 3. Treating an acute migraine headache is called _________ treatment. 4. ________________ refers to excessive skin hemorrhage causing red- purple patches under the skin.
